DataElement.preferredName: Plan Hematopoietic Cell Graft Umbilical Cord Blood Type Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the planned hematopoietic cell graft (product) was umbilical cord blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Plan Hematopoietic Cell Graft Umbilical Cord Blood Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient._Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
